PAGE.TITLE: Geometric series
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
In mathematics a geometric series is a series with a constant ration between successive terms. For example:
$$
\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{8} + \frac{1}{16} + \dots
$$
The sum of a geometric series with $n$ terms is given by:
$$
\sum_{i=0}^{n} x^{i}= 1+x+x^{2}+ \cdots + x^{n} =
{1-x^{n+1} \over 1-x}
$$
If $\vert x \vert < 1$:
$$
\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} x^{i}= 1+x+x^{2}+ \cdots + x^{n} + \cdots =
{1 \over 1-x} \qquad .
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to recognise geometric series.
You should be able to write out and manipulate geometric series using the capital sigma notation.
You should be able to give an expression for the sum of an geometric series with a finite number of terms.

You should be able to explain the conditions under which a geometric series with an infinite number of terms converges to a finite value and you should be able to write down the expression for the sum of such series.
